p: The anti-inflammatory assay was performed as previously published using activated THP-1 cells at a final concentration of 7.5x10 4 cells/well [ 9]. Cells treated with 1% DMSO served as negative control, whereas 100 ng/mL of lipopolysaccharide (LPS) from E. coli (Sigma-Aldrich) was used as a positive control. Experiments were carried out in triplicate and the final concentrations of DMSO per well were always ≤ 1%. EOs were tested at a final concentration of 7.5 μg/mL, which was selected based on the survival of the cell in the cytotoxic experiments.
